summary: This document is a draft protocol for the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program, established to compensate victims of sexual abuse by Jeffrey Epstein. It outlines the program's voluntary, independent administration by Kenneth R. Feinberg and Camille S. Biros, with consultation from Professor Marci A. Hamilton, and details eligibility criteria, claims submission, evaluation, payment processes, and confidentiality provisions.

connections.description: Both are nationally recognized claims administration experts retained by the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein to design the compensation program.
The Administrator (Biros) may, at her discretion and with claimant consent, consult with Professor Hamilton for expert advice on sexual abuse cases and program policies.
Biros is the Administrator of the compensation program funded by Epstein's Estate, but the program is independent and not controlled by the Estate.

keyFacts: The Epstein Victims' Compensation Program is a voluntary, independent program established to compensate victims of sexual abuse by Jeffrey Epstein, administered by Camille S. Biros.
The program has no cap on the total funds available or on individual compensation amounts, with the Estate obligated to pay all eligible claims as determined by the Administrator.
Eligibility extends to victims regardless of when or where the abuse occurred, even if claims are time-barred by statutes of limitations or if victims previously settled with Epstein.
The program includes consultation with sexual abuse expert Professor Marci A. Hamilton to inform the Administrator on abuse dynamics and victim sensitivities.
Claimants who accept compensation must sign a release dismissing all claims against the Estate but are not bound by confidentiality and may freely discuss their abuse.
